name: Ocean Technologies Group
description:
We are Ocean Technologies Group, the global learning and operational technologies company, empowering our customers to meet the challenges of shipping in the digital age.
We are built on historic and iconic maritime brands with over 60 years’ collective experience of helping the most successful ship operators achieve the highest standards of safety and operational excellence.
Together we have an unrivalled network of over 1,400 customers, 20,000 ships and over 1,000,000 seafarers along with the biggest data rich picture of learning and development behaviour in maritime history. It is this collective knowledge, experience and collaborative power that is helping us make the industry safer, stronger and better.

members.biography: Raal is Chief Creative Officer of Ocean Technologies Group (OTG) the leading provider of Human Capital Management software solutions to the Maritime Industry. Having been formed from the coming together of the world recognised Seagull and Videotel and strengthened by further acquisitions OTG boasts a substantial percentage of the world fleet and its seafarers as users of their learning, fleet management and crew management solution.Raal is responsible for leading brand development, marketing and communications activities for the group as well as its Industry outreach. As a keen participator in numerous Industry groups and forums, Raal evaluates the current and future status of the industry and the market to understand how best to serve the needs of OTG’s customers and stakeholders.Prior to becoming part of the group Raal was Managing Director of Videotel, where over fifteen years he gained extensive experience in the production of maritime training content and software solutions.Raal’s diverse background includes university lectureships in interaction design, information product design, and computer games design, which gave him invaluable experience in structuring and designing engaging learning material, evaluating learner performance and creating rewarding user experiences.

name: Cruise & Ferry Review
description:
Cruise & Ferry Review aims to be the best supplier of news and insight into the global passenger shipping industries via a bi-annual print magazine, website and app. Content covers both the cruise and ferry sectors, providing an in-depth look into the areas of building and refurbishment, marine operations, onboard experience, interior design, ports and destinations, and more.
First launched in the early 1990s, Cruise & Ferry Review was acquired by publishers Tudor Rose in 2011, whose investments have transformed the brand into the definitive resource for decision makers in the cruise and ferry industries. Tudor Rose has since created the annual Cruise & Ferry Interiors and Cruise & Ferry Itinerary Planning publications. The former celebrates the work of the individuals and companies involved in creating interiors onboard today’s passenger ships, while the latter explores how cruise line executives, destination experts, deployment specialists and port authorities create compelling itineraries.

To subscribe to the FREE digital edition, please visit: www.cruiseandferry.net/subscribe.aspx

description: ATPI Marine & Energy is an international leader in providing travel to the energy and shipping sectors. Amassing a century of experience within the marine sector, ATPI Marine & Energy is the travel management partner of choice for many of the world’s most successful shipping organisations. Our worldwide reach, 24/7 expertise and technology created specifically for the maritime industry enables your organisation to navigate the challenges of modern-day shipping with cost, efficiency and safety at the forefront of every strategy.

name: Qatar Airways
description:
Qatar Airways is
proud to be playing an important part in the repatriation of seafarers and
offshore workers stranded due to the pandemic, working closely with governments
and the maritime industry to operate hundreds of chartered and scheduled
flights to help reunite workers with their families and friends. We have never
stopped flying throughout the pandemic and today connect more than 140
destinations around the globe including key marine hubs. We operate a fleet of
the latest-generation aircraft, and offer an unrivalled level of service
including our exclusive Mariner Lounge at our home and hub, Hamad International
Airport in Doha, the State of Qatar. 
  
As travellers return
to the skies with Qatar Airways, they can take comfort knowing that they are
travelling with the only airline in the world that has, together with its
state-of-the-art global hub Hamad International Airport, achieved four 5-Star
Skytrax ratings – including the prestigious 5-Star Airline Rating, 5-Star
Airport Rating, 5-Star COVID-19 Airline Safety Rating and 5-Star COVID-19
Airport Safety Rating. These achievements highlight Qatar Airways’ commitment
to providing its passengers with an industry-leading experience at every point
of their journey, including the highest possible level of health and safety
standards that safeguard the wellbeing of its passengers both on the ground and
in the air.

name: Mintra
description:
Mintra is a leading provider of digital learning and human capital management (HCM) software solutions for safety-critical industries worldwide.  
We develop and deploy solutions that enable our customers to develop and deploy their people, readily demonstrate compliance and maximise operational efficiency. 
Formed in Oslo Norway in 1997 to provide ‘Multimedia INteractive TRAining’, Mintra now has over 145 staff across offices in Bergen, Oslo, and Stavanger in Norway, Dubai, Singapore, Limassol in Cyprus, and Aberdeen in the UK. 
For more than 30 years Mintra’s OCS HR crew management software has supported the operation of over 170,000 maritime workers and 1,800 vessels worldwide, ranging from oil and gas tankers to passenger ferries and drilling rigs. 
Mintra’s learning and competence management system, Trainingportal, delivers our portfolio of over 2,000 courses to more than 1.7 million workers worldwide. Trainingportal Offline ensures that training and competency activities can continue onboard vessels in areas of poor connectivity. 
Over the last 20 years, Mintra has developed one of the largest and most comprehensive portfolios of workforce compliance-based courses. Every 30 seconds a course is completed with Mintra.
To learn more please visit mintra.com.

name: Wärtsilä Voyage
description:
Wärtsilä Voyage in brief
Wärtsilä Voyage transforms how vessels perform their voyage by leveraging the latest digital technologies to deliver a step-change in safety, efficiency, reliability, and emissions. We are committed to creating a Smart Marine Ecosystem, whereby every vessel can connect to digital services that make voyaging safer and greener. With the broadest Smart Marine portfolio in the market, we are well positioned to lead the industry towards becoming digitally connected across the entire value chain and to be the first partner of choice when leveraging the latest digital technologies.

members.jobTitle: Regional Sales Director Americas & Global Simulation Business Development Director
members.biography: Neil has been in the maritime industry for over thirty years, both at sea and ashore, sailing on a variety of vessels, and having held an unlimited Masters certificate.  After moving ashore into marine operations, Neil joined Transas in 1999 and has since served in various positions in Commercial, Sales and Business development with the organization. Neil is currently Regional Sales Director for Wärtsilä Voyage in the Americas following acquisition of Transas by Wärtsilä in 2018.Neil has also taken on the role of global development of the Simulation and training business, in support of Wärtsilä Smart Marine solutions.  He is considered a subject matter expert in Maritime Simulation and Smart Marine Solutions, is a member of the Nautical Institute, and a contributor to many maritime industry organizations.

name: The Seamen's Church Institute
description: The Seamen’s Church Institute advocates for the personal, professional, and spiritual well-being of merchant mariners around the world. Through our Center for Maritime Education, Center for Mariner Advocacy, and Pastoral Care team, SCI promotes safety, dignity, and improved working and living conditions for the men and women serving in the maritime workplace. Founded in 1834 and affiliated with the Episcopal Church, though nondenominational in terms of its trustees, staff, and service to mariners, the Seamen’s Church Institute of New York & New Jersey (SCI) is the largest, most comprehensive mariners’ service agency in North America.

name: Epsilon Hellas
description:
Epsilon is a dedicated provider of quality crewing and training solutions to the most discerning Principals.
Today, Epsilon is privileged to be the crew and training provider of choice for an elite group of the most demanding shipping companies, as well as being a long-serving member of key maritime organizations. We manage crewing affairs for more than 500 vessels, we deploy approximately 5,900 seafarers at any point in time, and we train more than 1,000 seafarers on a monthly basis.
This collective competence is confidently built upon an extended value network that includes the most reputable shipping houses, our fully-controlled offices across nine countries, key institutional affiliations, and the most trustworthy partners. The net result is an unparalleled relational capital and an embedded know-how that are deployed for a sole purpose: to offer customized services and trouble-free solutions and benefits to our clients. We do so in ways that unconditionally meet our ethical standards, respect the well-being of our seafarers and employees and maintain the sustainability and future development of our operations.

members.biography:
Joanna is an experienced professional in Human Resources Management, specializing in Training & Development, with a demonstrated history of working in the maritime industry. In her current position as Training Manager, she manages the training activities of Epsilon Hellas Crew Management and Training group, by leading the operations of training services, professional development programs, and business development projects.

She is also a lecturer/ module leader in a private Greek college, which collaborates with the University of Essex and the University of Canterbury Christ, in the School of Shipping, where she teaches Human Resources Management in Shipping, Risk Management and Research Methods. At the same time she is the course director of Certificate in Crew Management provided by Lloyd's Maritime Academy. 

She is an avid learner and stays passionately curious, which explains her strong educational background with a Doctor of Philosophy candidency (Ph.D.c) in Business Administration and Management, focused on Human Resources and Organisational Behavior – Psychology, a Master’s Degree in Human Resources Management, a Diploma in Maritime Operations and Strategy and a Bachelor’s Degree in International and European Relations. She is also certified as an integrated marine auditor (ISM/ISPS/MLC) and a certified Trainer.

Joanna feels passionate about empowering women in leadership roles. She is a member of Women’s International Shipping & Trading Association (WISTA) and supports various organisations as a mentor.

name: Ocean Technologies Group
description: Ocean Technologies Group provides maritime professionals across the globe with digital learning, assessment, maritime HR and fleet management solutions. It is built on the world recognised e-learning providers Seagull Maritime and Videotel and has been further strengthened by the COEX, Compas, Marlins, MTS and Tero Marine brands. The group boasts over 100 years’ collective experience of helping the most successful ship operators achieve the highest standards of safety and operational excellence. Dedicated to realising the potential of every seafarer and every ship, Ocean Technologies Group and its global team of over 300 Oceaneers help make the industry safer, stronger and able to excel.

members.biography: Manish Singh is the Chief Executive Officer of Ocean Technologies Group. Following seagoing experience on various wet and dry tonnage types, Manish held senior management responsibilities in marine services and ship management businesses.In that time, he has helped refine the operating models involving crew management, ship management and technical support services and has an established track record for forging strategic partnerships and mergers with complementary marine services businesses.As a 3rd generation seafarer himself, Manish has placed the seafarer at the heart of Ocean Technologies Group’s product evolution and brings an extensive industry network across all maritime regions and cultures.

name: The Standard Club
description: The Standard Club is a mutual insurance association and member of the International Group of P&I clubs, owned by its shipowner members and controlled by a board of directors drawn from the membership. The club has been insuring shipowners, operators and charterers for their liabilities to third parties for over 100 years and insures about 10% of the world fleet. As well as providing core P&I insurance, the club offers a range of additional covers to ensure we are meeting our members’ needs. The Standard Club prides itself on quality of service to members, and sets great store in responsiveness and support at all times, especially in times of crisis. The Loss Prevention department works to minimise losses through ship surveys and a programme of educational events and publications.

We manage crewing affairs for more than 500 vessels, we deploy approximately 6,100 seafarers at any point in time, and we train more than 1,200 seafarers on a monthly basis. name:
Fraunhofer Center for 
Maritime Logistics and Services 
CML
description: The Fraunhofer Center for Maritime Logistics and Services CML develops innovative solutions for the maritime sector and the maritime supply chain. We support companies and institutions from shipping, port management and logistics in initiating and implementing future-oriented technologies and processes.   Starting from everyday challenges, our interdisciplinary teams develop customer-specific solutions for private and public clients. In the four research fields of Maritime Logistics, Port, Shipping and Shipbuilding, our employees transfer the latest scientific findings from the diverse research activities into practice-oriented applications. The focus is on solutions for end-to-end digitalization and process automation, service concepts, and AI-supported data analysis, as well as autonomous maritime systems and sustainable shipping. The innovative concepts are tested and improved at the CML through simulation, models and in real operation.

name: Qatar Airways
description: A multiple award-winning airline, Qatar Airways was recently announced as the ‘Airline of the Year’ at the 2021 World Airline Awards, managed by the international air transport rating organisation, Skytrax. It was also named ‘World’s Best Business Class’, ‘World’s Best Business Class Airline Lounge’, ‘World’s Best Business Class Airline Seat’, ‘World’s Best Business Class Onboard Catering’ and ‘Best Airline in the Middle East’. The airline continues to stand alone at the top of the industry having won the main prize for an unprecedented sixth time. Additionally,  the airline won the 'Investment in People' accolade at the Seatrade Awards 2021, in recognition of its contribution to the welfare of thousands of seafarers. Qatar Airways currently serves over 140 destinations and continues to rebuild its network in line with the recovery of global travel, in the context of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Mintra
description:
We're experts in eLearning and human capital management (HCM) software for safety-critical industries. 
We service over 2.2 million system users and 4,000 companies operating in some of the worlds most challenging environments. 
Formed in Oslo, Norway in 1997 to provide ‘Multimedia INteractive TRAining’, Mintra now has over 145 staff across offices in Bergen, Oslo and Stavanger in Norway, Singapore, Limassol in Cyprus and Aberdeen in the UK. 
For more than 30 years Mintra’s OCS HR  crew management software has supported the operation of over 260,000 seafarers and 1,800 vessels worldwide, ranging from oil and gas tankers to passenger ferries and drilling rigs. 
Mintra’s learning and competence management system, Trainingportal , delivers our portfolio of over 2,200 courses to more than 1.5 million workers worldwide. Trainingportal Offline ensures that training and competency activities can continue onboard vessels in areas of poor connectivity. 
Over the last 20 years, Mintra has developed one of the largest and most comprehensive portfolios of workforce compliance-based courses. 
Every 30 seconds a course is completed with Mintra.

name: Bigyellowfish
description: Bigyellowfish Technologies is an Employee Engagement and Behaviour Risk management platform. The platform focuses on three key areas of employee engagement: Mental health & Well being, Collaboration and Microlearning. Bigyellowfish leverages elements of Gamification, Behavioural Psychology and Data Science to provide organizations with tangible insights through the lens of their Employees so that they are able to make informed decisions at the right time.At the centre of driving a strong Safety Culture with a behaviour based approach, are the people. If one gets the Safety engagement with people right it will drive a long term safety transformation.Safety transformation to us means:1.	Reduced accidents and incidents2.	Reduced insurance liabilities3.	Improved commercial safety ratings & hence better employability4.	Happy and highly engaged crewBy adopting the Bigyellowfish Workplace Wellbeing Platform organisations can aim to achieve the above in the following ways:1.	Improved mental health and wellbeing- Higher resilience quotient of the employees / crew.2.	Visible leadership – Being more visible to the crew by breaking barriers of communication & enabling reach to the last mile employee / crew.3.	Build a platform of Trust and Transparency - Understanding the pulse of the employees and be able to quickly respond to their needs & challenges, continuously.4.	Be Proactive and Not reactive - Using data analytics, aim to stay ahead of the problems and be able to take decisions at the right time in the right mannerWhile the world is facing a pandemic and the maritime industry in specific is going through various challenges such as low crew morale, crew rotation and repatriation propelled by closing of borders, crew shortage due to the fear of pandemic, we believe it is important to quickly adapt and focus on the sustenance of the supply chain. The first step to this is to provide a safety net to the crew and ensure they are safe, happier and well engaged to work with your organisation. Bigyellowfish as a technology platform through its digital solutions will provide such a safety net and this will help augment organisational resilience & growth.The platform provides the employees a digital solution which helps them self manage through numerous exercises and games while at the same time provides them a seamless channel to access mental health support through numerous chatbots, experts (via text based consult). The platform also allows the users to be able to communicate directly to the management and vice versa via "Let's Talk Channel" for any issues which need immediate attention. This drives a sense of empowerment into the employees and provides a last mile connectivity to the management to drive their expectations. The Bigyellowfish platform drives learning into the flow of work in a micro and just in time manner. It helps organizations to drive learning with effectiveness in the most relevant and contextual manner. All the above does not require the end user to spend more than 5 to 10 mins a day. Organizations can choose from any of the products or even choose an integrated approach. We are currently working with large ship owners and managers in the maritime industry.
htmlDescription:
Bigyellowfish Technologies is an Employee Engagement and Behaviour Risk management platform. The platform focuses on three key areas of employee engagement: Mental health & Well being, Collaboration and Microlearning. Bigyellowfish leverages elements of Gamification, Behavioural Psychology and Data Science to provide organizations with tangible insights through the lens of their Employees so that they are able to make informed decisions at the right time.


At the centre of driving a strong Safety Culture with a behaviour based approach, are the people. If one gets the Safety engagement with people right it will drive a long term safety transformation.


Safety transformation to us means:


1. Reduced accidents and incidents

2. Reduced insurance liabilities

3. Improved commercial safety ratings & hence better employability

4. Happy and highly engaged crew


By adopting the Bigyellowfish Workplace Wellbeing Platform organisations can aim to achieve the above in the following ways:


1. Improved mental health and wellbeing- Higher resilience quotient of the employees / crew.

2. Visible leadership – Being more visible to the crew by breaking barriers of communication & enabling reach to the last mile employee / crew.

3. Build a platform of Trust and Transparency - Understanding the pulse of the employees and be able to quickly respond to their needs & challenges, continuously.

4. Be Proactive and Not reactive - Using data analytics, aim to stay ahead of the problems and be able to take decisions at the right time in the right manner


While the world is facing a pandemic and the maritime industry in specific is going through various challenges such as low crew morale, crew rotation and repatriation propelled by closing of borders, crew shortage due to the fear of pandemic, we believe it is important to quickly adapt and focus on the sustenance of the supply chain.


The first step to this is to provide a safety net to the crew and ensure they are safe, happier and well engaged to work with your organisation. Bigyellowfish as a technology platform through its digital solutions will provide such a safety net and this will help augment organisational resilience & growth.


The platform provides the employees a digital solution which helps them self manage through numerous exercises and games while at the same time provides them a seamless channel to access mental health support through numerous chatbots, experts (via text based consult). The platform also allows the users to be able to communicate directly to the management and vice versa via "Let's Talk Channel" for any issues which need immediate attention. This drives a sense of empowerment into the employees and provides a last mile connectivity to the management to drive their expectations. The Bigyellowfish platform drives learning into the flow of work in a micro and just in time manner. It helps organizations to drive learning with effectiveness in the most relevant and contextual manner. All the above does not require the end user to spend more than 5 to 10 mins a day. Organizations can choose from any of the products or even choose an integrated approach. We are currently working with large ship owners and managers in the maritime industry.

members.biography: A master mariner, quality and safety coach, mentor and more importantly,  a passionate sailor at heart with over 30 plus years of experience in the maritime industry. Capt. Soma brings to Bigyellowfish the seafarer first approach.He drives the vision to transform workplace experiences and performance standards of the frontline workforce in the industry towards an enriching and sustainable future of seafaring.He is an alumnus of UCLA Anderson School of Management, a member of the Digitalization committee of the Singapore Shipping Association, and an integral member of the start-up working group of the SSA.

Kunal comes with more than 20 years of corporate experience in the areas of business development, marketing, market making & and product building. He has extensively worked in sectors such as BFSI & and IT. As an entrepreneur, he started his first venture in 2015 with a vision to democratize access to mental and behavioral health care. With a lot of crucial learnings from his first venture, which also included deep insights from several business leaders across multiple sectors about their key motivations in the areas of workplace technologies, employee wellbeing, engagement and its desired impact on specific business metrics, he then co-founded Bigyellowfish.Kunal holds an MBA degree from NMIMS, Mumbai and is an alumnus of Shri Ram College of Commerce, Delhi. He is also a published author of a fiction novel and likes to dabble in thrillers & and science fiction.

Hi I’m Mel, before joining Bigyellowfish Technologies I came from a background of over 18 years of sales, marketing, client management and also training/teaching where I have taught young kids and teenagers alike. This extensive experience allowed me to realise the importance and vulnerability of the human mind, and it’s impact on behaviour and the risks this could pose in the work environment if left unattended. Bigyellowfish has shed much light on how these risks can be easily mitigated to reach high levels of safety with the aim of zero harm in-line with the fundamental ESG goals.
My career spans more than 10 years with global exposure to customer relations and marketing in multiple industries.

name: Maritime Trainer
description:
The Maritime Trainer is a global digital learning technology and interactive content development company dedicated to meeting industry requirements like TMSA and DryBMS for the selection and development of crew, to achieve environmental, safety, and operational excellence. 
Established in 2014, Maritime Trainer is giving service to more than 70 global shipping companies with more than 30.000 seafarers.  
With our platform that exceeds the industry requirements, the shipping companies are capable of managing job applications/GDPR, competency, personality, aptitude and Maritime English assessments, company orientation and pre-joining training, CBT training that covers both occupational and soft skills, resilience training, and onboard training.  
We can also generate customized interactive CBTs, 3D animations, and VR Based Simulations for your specific requirements.

name: Inmarsat
description: Inmarsat is the world leader in global, mobile satellite communications. It owns and operates the world’s most diverse global portfolio of mobile telecommunications satellite networks, and holds a multi-layered, global spectrum portfolio, covering L-band, Ka-band and S-band, enabling unparalleled breadth and diversity in the solutions it provides. Inmarsat’s long-established global distribution network includes not only the world’s leading channel partners but also its own strong direct retail capabilities, enabling end to end customer service assurance.The company has an unrivalled track record of operating the world’s most reliable global mobile satellite telecommunications networks, sustaining business and mission critical safety & operational applications for more than 40 years. It is also a major driving force behind technological innovation in mobile satellite communications, sustaining its leadership through a substantial investment and a powerful network of technology and manufacturing partners.Inmarsat operates across a diversified portfolio of sectors with the financial resources to fund its business strategy and holds leading positions in the Maritime, Government, Aviation and Enterprise satcoms markets, operating consistently as a trusted, responsive and high-quality partner to its customers across the globe.For further information, follow us on LinkedIn or on Twitter @InmarsatGlobal.

name: American Bureau Of Shipping (ABS)
description: As a leading provider of classification services to the global offshore and marine industries, ABS is guided by its mission to promote security of life, property and the natural environment. ABS offers support during initial concept design, design approval and construction and provides lifecycle services. ABS offers an independent and uncompromised perspective on classification and statutory critical items. ABS leverages its years of experience in working with the marine industry to the benefit of our clients by providing an impartial assessment that relies on time-tested practical survey assessment techniques and the most advanced engineering rigor. Through a global network, ABS delivers services and solutions to clients, providing core competencies of survey, engineering and auditing. ABS’ vast network of offices around the world provides a flexible and highly efficient support system that all use the same consistent approach when applying various rules and requirements. The commitment to service is what distinguishes ABS as a true class leader and a trusted partner to our clients throughout the life of their assets. ABS has an unparalleled commitment to safety that underscores all that it does as an organization. The safety record of the ABS-classed fleet validates our commitment to safety leadership. The fleet has consistently and significantly outperformed industry averages in both Overall Serious Casualties and Hull & Machinery Casualties. Standing on its record of independence, exceptional class service, safety and technology leadership, ABS delivers value at every stage of development of an offshore asset or marine vessel. With a passion for making the world a safer place, while also delivering practical and innovative solutions, ABS stands ready to assist and advance safety in the marine and offshore energy industries.

name: Middle East Fuji LLC
description: Middle East Fuji LLC (www.mef.ae) was established in the UAE in 1993 to offer marine supply and related services for ships calling UAE ports.  As part of Fuji Trading group global supply solutions, we standardize the products and services to meet the satisfaction of our customers.  We cater to the requirements of the most well-known marine operators in globally and regionally, with excellent product range and service solutions.Middle East Fuji provide complete range of MRO services to maritime industry including ship supply services (technical stores – consumable, valves, fittings, tools, accessories, ropes and hawsers, food provisions and bonded goods), marine engineering and shipping agency services. MEF provides clearing, storage, delivery and full range of freight forwarding services for owner supplied stores and spares. We offer long term storage solutions for warranty spares as well. MEF serve all kind of maritime customers – passenger lines, merchant vessels, armed forced and naval ships. Middle East Fuji Engineering, which has more than 30 factory trained, maker certified service engineers provide after sales services on behalf of the machinery manufacturers in the region.  The team are specialized in all critical marine related requirements – being it mechanical, automation or inspection services.  We represent many Japanese and Korean manufacturers in the region, including Shinko Pumps, Fukui Safety valves, Kosaka pumps, Mitsubishi Steering Gear systems etc. MEF Group is accredited with all applicable ISO and other standards related to its operation –ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 22000, ISO 45001 and HACCP – to provide the best quality services to its customers at all times.

members.biography:
Ali Shehab is the DNV Global Director of Special Projects and Services where his role to streamline the regional and global ongoing projects and services, as well as, development of market share and strengthen the position of DNV and the Maritime and Oil & Gas Industries. Before assuming this position in July 2021, he was the former Acting Chief Executive Officer of the Kuwait Oil Tanker Company (KOTC), the Maritime Transportation arm of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation (KPC), after having serving there for almost 36 years in various positions of the Company, including 7+ years as Deputy Chief Executive Officer Fleet Operations where he oversaw KOTC’s Oil Tanker Fleet Operations, Marine Agency, and the main Gas Filling Branches that supply domestic and industrial LPG to the whole of State of Kuwait. 

He is a marine engineer professional educated at the South Tyneside College north of England in the United Kingdom, trained and worked on KOTC vessels as a seagoing Marine Chief Engineer from 1985 to 2001, after which he operated fleet vessels in the capacity of Technical Superintendent and further developed in his carrier to General Superintendent and later assumed various managerial positions for Fleet New-building Group, as well as, Fleet Personal Group of the Fleet Operations Directorate, including 3 years as Site Manager at Hyundai Heavy Industries Ulsan Korea in 2005 to 2007. His mid level management development was from 2005 to 2013 during which he was involved and managing the company crucial tanker fleet development for 26 tankers of different types and sizes from 2004 to 2021, built to the latest industry requirements, digitally ready and designed eco-friendly.

In July 2013 he was placed in the higher management position in the capacity of Deputy Chief Operating Officer for Fleet Operations and then in addition to this role, he assumed the position of Acting Chief Operating Officer in June 2018 till his retirement time with KOTC in Feb 2021 completing almost 36 years. During his senior position role with KOTC, he focused on excelling KOTC position in the Maritime Industry and to continue being a leader in the safe transportation of hydrocarbons by sea, in addition, he focused on the development of KOTC employees both on ships and onshore.

He is an active individual who has been involved in various executive roles and positions primarily in the maritime industry, nonetheless, is actively involved in Oil & Gas Ind, and assisting individuals and organizations to excel their business and provide them with opportunities of collaboration and growth.

My seagoing career built up with crude oil tankers and continued with chemical and product tankers, a total of 7 years at sea.

I’m Co-Founder and COO of MTR Informatics, Training and Consultancy Ltd. Co..

Ozgur is the Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Maritime Trainer since 2011.His main objective is establishing the strategy, aligning the right human resources around this strategy and let them create innovative and end to end digital training solutions to the shipping companies and seafarers to meet demanding industry requirements.Prior to start his journey at Maritime Trainer, he worked on various tanker types, worked as a lecturer at a Maritime Academy, served as the Training Coordinator of two major Shipping Companies, established and Managed Turkey's top crewing agency. He has a wealth of experience on developing and delivering maritime, safety, human factors and simulator training.Using all these skills, together with a young and talented team, he managed to create a distinctive platform and cutting-edge content to assist shipping companies select the best candidate, train and retain them in an affordable manner. He also participates in the Graduate Club, the Chamber of Shipping, and charities that support efforts to address the issues facing seafarers.

1. Log out and back in again


2. Try to use an incognito window

members.biography: Neil has been in the maritime industry for over thirty years, both at sea and ashore, sailing on a variety of vessels, and having held an unlimited Masters certificate. After moving ashore into marine operations, Neil joined Transas in 1999 and has since served in various positions in Commercial, Sales and Business development within the organization. Neil took the role of Regional GM for Wärtsilä Voyage in the Americas following acquisition of Transas by Wärtsilä in 2018.Neil currently holds the position of General Manager for Global sales of Simulation and training solutions. He is considered a subject matter expert in Maritime Simulation and Smart Marine Solutions, is a member of the Nautical Institute, and a contributor to many maritime industry organizations.

I am passionate about building features across the full stack, focusing on reliability, scalability, and security for the modern web. I leverage my nautical science and engineering management background to create innovative, user-oriented products that solve real-world problems. I also enjoy hiring, mentoring, and supporting developers, fostering a culture of collaboration, productivity, and happiness. As a lifelong learner, I constantly update my skills and knowledge, and I am currently exploring Golang and blockchain development.

Tim Lodder is Founder and CEO of Blue Orange Wave. The company is a global provider in the maritime and mobility industries, including shipping, offshore oil, gas, wind, and renewable energy sectors. The company has established itself as a leader in supplying innovative training technology, such as maritime VR, E-learning -, learning experience -, and micro-learning platforms combined with analysis, design, consultancy, and support as one interactive, flexible solution with unparalleled functionality. It is in Tim’s nature to aim and ensure success for all his customers by matching the most suitable training technology product to each of them and securing full support throughout the implementation process and operational usage. Prior to casting off Blue Orange Wave end 2017, Tim started his maritime career on passenger ships where he worked himself up the ranks to First Officer and finally became a Captain on a 100m+ Yacht. In 2013 Tim persuaded a continuation of his career ashore and worked during a period of almost five years in several operational, commercial, and regulatory positions for market leading companies related to maritime training & education, maritime VR simulation software and E-Learning

The world of maritime digital education is changing. 

Being a catalyst for change in digital maritime education has demanded transformation, to make digital learning not only more flexible and available to seafarers and maritime companies across the world, but viable. 

And the output? Productive, fulfilled, valued and more focused maritime workforces, achieving their digital learning goals and professional development, wherever they happen to be in the world. 

My focus is on continuous forward momentum for the business; operations of client delivery, business development, all aspects of compliance, marketing and finance. 

Known for getting the job done and the right strategy in place to achieve ‘commercial edge’, I’m also highly approachable. I like to think it’s a down-to-earth manner and love of talking to people about their aspirations and what they want from life that’s as responsible for the results I’ve achieved as it is my professional qualifications and studies in Law, Executive Coaching and HR. 

Managing teams of global associate consultants and subject matter experts, design and delivery of graduate assessment centres, delivering £500k savings in 12 months and upskilling HR teams are just some of my key achievements in my over-20 years’ experience. And now I’m applying that know-how to Onboard Maritime, our partners, clients and cadets and loving it. 

Specialities: maritime training; virtual learning, lecturing, coaching, digital learning, maritime education, qualitative research, Business Operations, Direct Resourcing, Project Management, Talent Acquisition, Upskilling Teams, Restructures, HR Management, Candidate Management Strategies, Team Management, Performance Management, Coaching.

name: AEGIR-Marine BV
description: AEGIR-Marine is an OEM-independent manufacturer and service provider of stern seals and propulsion parts. With ten offices and service hubs strategically located around the world, we provide 24/7 service and support to the international shipping industry. This includes repairs, overhauls and retrofits of stern tube seals, thrusters (bow, stern and azimuth), CPPs, FPPs and stabilizers. We also manufacture our own class-approved spare parts: this enables us to act fast to minimise your downtime. Our service engineers are honest and experienced, working afloat, in-dock, in-house or even underwater to get the job done.We are a company with forward-thinking values: we work towards the increasing sustainability of the shipping industry, making ships greener for the benefit of all. Furthermore, AEGIR-Marine is the founder of the Maritime Remanufacturing Network: a growing group of specialist companies working together to make the maritime industry more sustainable.

description: Setting a green course - sustainable solutions for maritime vesselsSiemens Energy delivers cutting-edge electrical equipment, systems, solutions, and services for a wide range of commercial vessels, naval vessels, and submarines. In addition to offering maritime solutions for power, drive, energy management, automation, and digital technologies, Siemens Energy is a globally recognized expert partner for the marine industry. Our digital applications open up new opportunities for enhancing efficiency and cost reduction while ensuring compliance with current environmental regulations and sustainability goals. Our propulsion solutions, BlueDrive hybrid, fuel cells, and batteries for marine vessels, contribute to their improved environmental friendliness and economic efficiency. Furthermore, we offer solutions to optimize ship operations, leading to reduced operational costs and a smaller carbon footprint.

Fay has been the President and CEO of mimik since January 2020. She founded the company as Disternet, which was later rebranded to mimik.

While incubating mimik; Fay was also the CEO of a group of mobile companies under Nantworks, including Tensorcom, NantMobile, and Mobile Genomic Health, leading the consumerization health solutions between 2014 – 2016.

Prior to NantWorks, Fay was the CEO of Vodafone xone. Fay successfully launched Vodafone xone in Silicon Valley in September 2011, which became the global incubation center of the Vodafone Group and the beta brand for Vodafone consumers in the UK, Italy, Spain, Germany, and Egypt. Fay spearheaded the partnership work with emerging and disruptive technologies to enable start-up companies to develop, test, and prepare for commercial deployment in global markets. Additionally, her role expanded to lead Vodafone Ventures, the strategic corporate venture capital arm of Vodafone Group. Fay was also the President of Vodafone Americas Foundation, an outreach program whose mission is to mobilize communities to resolve shared problems and to enable mobile technology to advance social change in addition to exceptional leadership and vision.
Prior to Vodafone, Fay was the co-founder and CEO of two other start-up companies L3 Technology, Mobidia that was acquired by App Annie Inc.
Fay is an official member of the Forbes Technology Council. Fay has authored 12 patents; she was recognized as the 2018 Alumni of the year at Concordia University. In 2014, she was named by San Francisco Business Week as one of the most influential women business leaders in Silicon Valley.  In 2007, she was the Canadian technology and innovation representative to the White House. Fay received the distinguished Business in Vancouver’s 2006 “Top 40 Under 40” award presented to outstanding leaders in their chosen fields.
Fay is a highly sought-after global speaker, and industry thought leader given her specialization in digital communications, software applications, and protocol development. Fay is also currently the Executive Chairman of H2 Wellness and Advisor to StudyTracks.

members.biography:
Mohammed Nowfal Pakkada is the General Manager of Amit Marine Services FZE and Amit Marine Limited, a leading maritime integrator with over four decades of industry expertise. With a strong technical background, Nowfal holds a degree in Engineering and an MBA in Project Management. He is also a certified Project Management Professional (PMP), further enhancing his ability to manage complex, large-scale projects efficiently.

Nowfal has extensive expertise in navigation and communication (NAVCOM), automation systems, life-saving appliances and fire-fighting apparatus (LSA/FFA), satellite communications (SATCOM), and diving solutions within the maritime sector. Under his leadership, Amit Marine continues to thrive as a key player in providing integrated maritime solutions to a wide range of clients.

Nowfal is currently spearheading the expansion of Amit Marine’s operations into Saudi Arabia, with established offices and technical teams across Jeddah, Khobar, and Riyadh. His forward-thinking approach and deep industry knowledge make him a pivotal figure in driving growth and innovation in the region's maritime industry.

Abi is a seasoned events specialist with extensive experience within corporate events. Abi joined Artemis Technologies in May 2022 and leads the Events Team. Within Artemis Technologies, Abi is responsible for event strategy development and the execution of a varied event program to drive brand awareness, engagement and support organizational goals. Abi’s previous experience includes working within fast paced hospitality and tourism industries, plus building and delivering events programs in leading technology companies and business membership organisation, London Chamber of Commerce & Industry (LCCI).
